meanings.definition: A person who murmurs or mumbles in a low, indistinct voice.
meanings.sent1: The quiet murmurers in the library were asked to keep their voices down.
meanings.sent2: The murmurers of the group were barely audible in the background.
meanings.sent3: The murmurers at the meeting seemed to be discussing a secret plan.
meanings.sent4: The murmurers of the forest whispered ancient stories to the trees.
meanings.sent5: The murmurers in the haunted house sent shivers down my spine.

meanings.definition: Plural form of murmur, meaning a low, continuous sound.
meanings.sent1: The soft murmurers of the stream created a peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The distant murmurers of the city could be heard from the hilltop.
meanings.sent3: The murmurers of the wind through the leaves sounded like a lullaby.
meanings.sent4: The murmurers of the crowd blended into a soothing background noise.
meanings.sent5: The murmurers of the rain on the roof helped me fall asleep.
